meanings.definition: Each of the parts into which something is or may be divided.
meanings.sent1: The orange was divided into segments for easy sharing.
meanings.sent2: She counted the segments of the orange before eating them.
meanings.sent3: The segments of the puzzle fit perfectly together.
meanings.sent4: The segments of the market cater to different customer needs.
meanings.sent5: The caterpillar moved in distinct segments along the branch.

meanings.definition: A part of a line that is bounded by two distinct end points.
meanings.sent1: The line was divided into segments to measure its length.
meanings.sent2: He marked the segments on the ruler for accurate measurements.
meanings.sent3: The segments of the road were clearly marked for drivers.
meanings.sent4: The segments of the song flowed seamlessly from one to the next.
meanings.sent5: The segments of the bridge connected the two sides of the river.

meanings.sent1: She carefully segments the cake before serving it.
meanings.sent2: The chef segments the vegetables for the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: He segments his study time to cover all subjects effectively.
meanings.sent4: The company plans to segment the market for targeted advertising.
meanings.sent5: The teacher segments the class into small groups for discussions.
